attributes.action: Stop Reducing our Armed Forces and Spend 3% of GDP. CUT AID to 0.3% to fund it.
attributes.background: When I say "reduce" I mean in three ways: Funding, manpower & resources and credibility. We're told the Government spends 2% of GDP on defence and we have "the second largest budget in NATO... Largest in Europe". Then why can't we even match the French in capability anymore? Spend 3% GDP on Defence.
attributes.additional_details: France has 23 Destroyers and Frigates. We've 19. They've 3 Amphibious ships. We've 2 which are now going to be scrapped. Their Army is 30,000 bigger. You now want to cut another 14,000 and are talking about merging two extremely distinct units: Royal Marines and Parachute Regiment. It's a joke. You don't want the Army to "Be the Best" and the new adverts are laughable. Recruits join for war fighting, adventure and service. Not for PC. That 2% clearly feels like 1% and those in charge are inept.

attributes.action: Bring forward the 2020 London Mayoral Elections to 2019.
attributes.background: The 2020 London mayoral elections should be brought forward from 2020 to 2019 in order to de-conflict with a possible general election also due 2020.
attributes.additional_details:
The current London assembly is running with the idea that the election should be delayed until 2021 because of the chance of a general election in the same year (2020). This will give the current mayor an extra 12 months in power without being re-elected.

Londoners should be given the opportunity to select a new mayor sooner rather than later. The people of London must be given the chance to rid themselves of the massive increase in crime associated with the current mayor.

attributes.action: Impose an immediate ban on the use of Polystyrene in packaging.
attributes.background: Polystyrene is easily replaced with biodegradable alternatives. Polystyrene cannot be easily recycled and usually ends up in either landfill sites or the sea. Polystyrene breaks down easily to ever smaller partials which poison the food chain, and takes thousands of years to break down.

attributes.action: Restrict child benefit to the first two children in a family
attributes.background: The population of the world generally and of the UK specifically is growing at an alarming rate. The government should not be subsidising parents who choose to have larger families. It is therefore proposed that child benefit should be capped at two children per family

attributes.action: Require labelling of all products which contain pig or its bye products
attributes.background: Lot of products edible or for human use are in the market which contain pig and its bye products without specifying. Jellies, soaps, breads and spreads etc. can contain lard or pig bones without specifying. This hurts lots of people’s sentiments and beliefs.

attributes.action: Urge the Indian Government to investigate and prevent Sterlite pollution
attributes.background: British company Vedanta Sterlite Copper begun construction of a new 4 million tonne/year smelter, almost doubling capacity. The existing smelter is believed to have continuously polluted the water and air since 1996, causing respiratory, dermal infections and other illness, particularly in children.
attributes.additional_details:
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/10-killed-as-cops-fire-on-anti-sterlite-protesters-in-tuticorin/articleshow/64279479.cms 
The Env Impact Assessment is believed to be a sham. Coastal regulations forbidding the location of industrial plant within 25km of the Gulf of Mannar biosphere reserve were ignored. Reports of illegal waste dumps and port data reveal the use of highly contaminated copper concentrates and indicate that waste has been disposed of in the Gulf of Mannar.

attributes.action: Negotiate a deal to keep the UK in the Digital Single Market
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call upon HM Government to specifically negotiate the UKs future relationship to the Digital Single Market in the final Brexit deal.  Ignoring the digital economy would put the UK’s future prosperity and thousands of jobs unnecessarily at risk.
attributes.additional_details:
The digital economy is borderless yet depends on consumer trust and business confidence. Leaving the Digital Single Market will tax that confidence in more ways than one. We ask the HM Government to start being responsible for publicly addressing:
(1) future relations to EU agencies such as ENISA and EDPB 
(2) participation in EU funded research 
(3) regulatory alignment to EU rules for telecoms (incl. free roaming), data protection, consumer rights, audio visual media services, and copyright.

attributes.action: Make UK standard parking spaces bigger.
attributes.background: Parking space is a premium in most cities and towns. However, most spaces are barely wider than a vehicle. A UK standard parking space is 2.4m wide, by 4.8m. The average family car is 2.1m x 4.8m. Park perfectly and you get 150mm either side to open a door. This is not enough for most vehicle users.
attributes.additional_details:
You should be able to park your vehicle and get in or out without struggling. You should also not have to worry about potential damage which can often be sustained in your absence. Causing needless cost and loss of earnings, maybe even insurance hikes. Town and city planners have overlooked this for years, as have Supermarkets and retail parks.
It's time, as consumers, that we took a stand and put the onus onto those profiting from our misery.
Your vote could help to change this.

attributes.action: Create a Memorial Day for all killed working in emergency services
attributes.background: Many people in the emergency services sadly lose their lives while carrying out their duty. We should create a day to remember them, separate from Remembrance Sunday and other memorial days.

attributes.action: Cancel HS2 and put the money into road repairs and improvement.
attributes.background:
Pot holes are causing serious damage to vehicles and injury to road users such cyclists and motorcyclists. All are at serious risk.

So cancel HS2 with its budget of £15 billion and put the money to work right away on the roads. That will benefit more people than a high speed rail link.

attributes.action: Debate scrapping the television licence fee and discuss other funding options.
attributes.background: We currently pay £147 per year for a TV licence, the bulk of which goes to the BBC, very little BBC programming these days is of the quality expected, please debate in the Commons with regards scrapping this fee and discuss more viable funding options.

attributes.action: Amend the Gender Recognition Act 2004 to remove the need for a medical diagnosis
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, urge the government of the United Kingdom of Great Britain to remove any requirement for a diagnosis of gender dysphoria (as endorsed by a psychiatrist or medical practitioner) to receive a gender recognition certificate under the Gender Recognition Act of 2004.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, the GRA04 requires a psychiatrist or medical practitioner to diagnose someone with gender dysphoria in order to gain a gender recognition certificate. This is wrong because:

1) Not all transgender people experience dysphoia.
2) There are often considerable waits to see a psychologist or medical practitioner about gender issues, and so this delays the whole process.
3) Seeing someone about gender issues is often invasive, or otherwise uncomfortable.

attributes.action: Help me to deport my little brother from a Singaporean prison back to the UK
attributes.background: In the November of 2016 19 year old Lorenzo Dentamaro, was arrested in Singapore on accusations of fraud. He spent 6 months on bail battling the case only to be made an example of and harshly served with 3 years inprisomment. He is currently in 16 man cell, suffering in 30 plus temperatures.
attributes.additional_details: My family is suffering, I have grandparents that are very old and may never have the opportunity to see him again. We have to travel 13 hours to see him for only 20 minutes and I just want to bring him back home so he can complete his sentence in the UK. My mother is depressed, our lives have been impacted serverely and I am constantly living on breaking point. I just want to bring him home.

attributes.action: Car Tax to start from the day you Tax your car and end the day you sell.
attributes.background: If someone buys a car from me mid month and they part exchange their old car they are losing out twice. This is because the new car tax is back dated to the beginning of the month, and the old car can only claim every complete month remaining!

attributes.action: The People's Mandate. Electorate vote on the agenda of next parliament.
attributes.background: Give the electorate a preliminary vote in the year before each General Election, that will allow them to choose the agenda of the next parliament & provide the political parties with a 'people's mandate' by which they design their manifestos to serve. For too long the word 'Mandate' has been abused.
attributes.additional_details: This 'Preliminary Vote' could be in the form of a list of government departments or pressing issues that the country faces. The electorate would vote on their top 3 priorities and this would be collated to provide the future government with a democratic mandate from which to form their manifestos. To date, the people get what they are given. With a preliminary vote on issues of importance the people get to be more involved in driving the political policy of the next parliament.

attributes.action: Mandatory for all alcoholic beverages to display nutritional information
attributes.background: I suffer with type 1 diabetes but want to lead a normal life. Identifying the total carbohydrate content of a beer from various internet searches is difficult and unreliable. Furthmore we have a nation of growing waistbands, shouldn't the calorific content of alcohol be visible to inform consumers?

attributes.action: "Warning" labels on dog flea shampoos containing Pyrethrum as toxic to cats.
attributes.background: I washed my cat with dog flea shampoo. There was no warning label on the product. In small writing amongst other text it stated it should never be used on cats. Unfortunately, my beloved companion died 2 days later. This type of poisoning is not uncommon.
attributes.additional_details: The product I used was a standard dog flea shampoo purchased over the counter for my dog weeks beforehand, but I didn't think it would be harmful to my cat.  Clear, informed "Warning" labels should be on the front of such products indicating they are toxic to cats. This will hopefully prevent other cats from being harmed or dying as a result of the chemical Pyrethrum which they can't metabolise, yet dogs can.

attributes.action: Add miscarriges into the secondary school sex education national curriculum
attributes.background: Last year I had two miscarriges (6 & 9 weeks). I felt so alone & was given limited information in the form of a leaflet from NHS staff. Everyone I told said ‘it happens to lots of women’, ‘at least you know you can conceive’ No one previously warned me about miscarriges or the signs and symptoms.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that miscarriages should be a part of the national curriculum to educate both boys and girls on how and why it happens and the emotional and physical toll it can take on both parents. It is such a taboo subject and yet if so many women experience it why don’t we talk about it so no one feels alone or unsure of their symptoms.

attributes.action: Set up a Royal Commission to look into the funding model and use of the NHS
attributes.background: The funding model of the NHS has been a political football for decades, yet it is perhaps the more fundamental of services. Its funding is too important to be decided by the conflicting interests of political parties. It's use needs to be examined to decide whether its current use is sustainable

attributes.action: Give the money we will spend making UK passports blue to the NHS
attributes.background: Blue passports are little more than a hidden cost of Brexit and a vanity project. No one either for or against Brexit could possibly believe that the colour of our passports is more important than the health of society.

attributes.action: Reform Private Member's Bill procedure so that an objection needs to be seconded
attributes.background: Evidenced today; Friday 15th June 2018, a Private Members Bill was objected to by a lone MP. The Private Members Bill process allows for Bills to be introduced by MPs and Lords who are not government ministers, furthering the democratic process. The objection by one MP hinders that process.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is to request that parliamentary procedures be modernised. When an opportunity arises where an MP may object to a reading of a Private Bill or Private Member Bill, any objection must be seconded by another MP for it to be recognised. This change will allow for the democratic process to represent the electorate without it being compromised by a lone voice.

attributes.action: Proportional charge for all Governmental Fixed Penalty Notices and Fines.
attributes.background: We, the signed, call on the government to implement the same policy that is already practiced by  governments in other european countries such as Denmark and Iceland in which Fines are charged to a proportion of the offenders income. This way punishment is same for all, as it is meant to be in law.
attributes.additional_details:
Think about it this way 2 people walking down the road both drop litter and are given a fixed penalty notice of £80. The first person comes from a household earning £200 a week and the other £200 a day. This is not a fair measure, this nearly 7x worse for the person who can afford it the least.

A proportional system means both parties receive the same impact and that impact can be kept from being up to half the weekly income of people who are potentially facing growing poverty.

attributes.action: Make Government spending transparent, adjust funding "increases" for inflation
attributes.background: Often funding increases are announced, which amount to a funding cut after inflation. The only transparent approach is to deflate figures for inflation to give an increase figure in "real terms".
attributes.additional_details:
Full Fact provides evidence that the Grant review for police funding amounts to a cut after inflation.
https://fullfact.org/crime/police-funding-england-and-wales/

Conservatives say Labour voted against an increase.
https://www.facebook.com/conservatives/photos/a.288165009278.146725.8807334278/10155780194029279/?type=3&theater

Labour say Conservatives voted for a real terms cut.
https://www.facebook.com/labourparty/posts/10155283147077411

attributes.action: Change the way the dangerous dogs act is administered
attributes.background: Instead of dogs being unfairly imprisoned based on a non confirmed act of aggression, have the authorities act upon this in a timely manner to prevent stress to the animal. This stress is unjustified and an act of cruelty towards animals where the animal where there is evidence to the contrary.
attributes.additional_details: I write this based on a personal experience where a family dog has been in custody of an animal shelter based on false allegations. There is evidence to show the allegations are false yet the authorities are not acting upon this in a timely manner. The stress this causes to an animal is astronomical and should be deemed as cruelty which is unlawful. I call for the government to place a time frame on when cases are heard in court or for legislation to be brought forward to review evidence sooner.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for teachers to search students' phones without consent.
attributes.background: Ever since 2011 it has been legal for teachers to search through students’ phones without the consent of the student. Students are human as well, and just because we are on school grounds does not mean we should lose our rights - unconsented searches are a complete violation of our rights to privacy
attributes.additional_details: Teachers can search through student’s phones with little more information than someone saying something to the teacher. This is completely ridiculous and happened recently at a school - where boys were forced to hand over their phones for the teacher to go through, despite the fact that what the teacher was insinuating had not happened and they had no more evidence to go through the phone other than a meaningless accusation. This is a violation of our privacy - and should not be allowed.

attributes.action: Make Greyhound racing illegal in the U.K .
attributes.background: Greyhound racing must be banned in the U.K. This "sport" remains legal in 8 countries and one of them is the U.K. The sport is inhumane and over 10,000 greyhounds vanish/die every year. This is why we believe it has to stop . #YouBetTheyDie #NoGreyhoundRacing
attributes.additional_details: Greyhound racing is a popular industry here in the U.K. Beautiful dogs race at ground-scaring speeds; the thrill making quick quid off a brutal bet - this all entices many dog-racing enthusiasts, betters and gamblers alike. However, the reality is greyhound-racing is cruel and disgusting. Over 10,000 greyhounds a year are tossed aside due to being "useless". Around 8,000 of these are retired. These poor dogs are then left to starve, abandoned, murdered, sold for dissection purposes and worse.

attributes.action: Pressure the Cameroon government to organise a referendum in Southern Cameroons.
attributes.background: Southern Cameroon was a Trust territory of the UK with its mandate ending in 1961 where a Plebiscite was organised by the UN giving the people the option of either joining Cameroon/Nigeria to gain its independence.The present crisis in the region is a direct consequence of the failure that process
attributes.additional_details:
Britain has a key role to play in the present crisis in Southern Cameroons.On 1st October 2017 Southern Cameroons reasserted its independence from Cameroun. It now has an interim government and now recognizes itself as the Republic of Ambazonia.

The problem in Southern Cameroons is a consequence of failed decolonisation.UN resolution 1514 reaffirms the right of every people to self determination.Denial of that right or subjugation of a people to an alien power is a frequent cause of conflict.

attributes.action: Set the living wage age bracket to 21 and over
attributes.background: At the age of 21 you are regarding as an adult. You pay the same rates as a person 25+ and receive no tax reduction, discount on food/petrol/electricity/mortgage bills, etc. Why then, does the living wage only apply to the 25 and overs? Help the younger home owners and families live and provide.
attributes.additional_details:
Speaking from a personal perspective, my partner and I have 2 cars on finance, own a house and have started a family. Why should we not be entitled to the living wage?

At the age of 16 you are permitted to have a child and be expected to provide. At 17 you can drive and own a car, which needs upkeep. At the age of 18 you can buy a home which come with bills and expenses.

To discriminate on age is unacceptable. The government does not know an individuals curcumstance.

attributes.action: Justice for Zainab! Put pressure on the Pakistani government to act on rape.
attributes.background: Zainab is a 7 year old girl who was abducted when on her way to her Islamic lessons. She was raped and murdered and left in a pile of rubbish. Her parents were away on Ummrah when this had happened. Action needs to be taken! Pressure needs to be put on the Pakistani government to take rape seriously
attributes.additional_details: Put pressure on the government to introduce sexual abuse awareness to children! What is appropriate and what is not.

attributes.action: Stop all serving politicians from being included in any Honours lists
attributes.background: Time and time again who ever is in government are seen to be rewarding loyal members of their party even if they aren't doing a good job. Being Knighted for sitting on a committee or being a loyal party member isn't good enough and is making a joke of the whole system.

attributes.action: Lower the rate of duty on alcoholic beverages in pubs (and restaurants?)
attributes.background: Pubs form a valuable social and community function in many towns and villages and help to make Britain what it is. Towns and villages with good pubs are better than those without. This should be recognised by Government. It is the role of good Government to make this country a better place to live.
attributes.additional_details:
Communal drinking and socialising forms a valuable function in terms of social cohesion and sense of community. Home drinking or street drinking can be actively detrimental to this. Making retail purchased alcohol relatively more expensive would, I believe, help to discourage this. The alternative of course would be raising the level of duty charged on alcoholic beverages bought from retail outlets.

Many thanks for your time.

attributes.action: Classify professional avoidable negligence as a criminal act
attributes.background: Of course mistakes happen, but too many are avoidable, and are classified as 'civil'. Many are not subject to criminal investigation, when sometimes this should be the case. 'Individuals' should also be held accountable. This would be a deterrent and lower the authority compensation liability.
attributes.additional_details: Professionals with a duty of care be it medical, social care, community or residential care that cause avoidable physical or mental harm, abuse, neglect or death through direct involvement and incorrect decision making, should be fully investigated through the justice system and the crown prosecution service and charged with criminal neglect. The logic is that it would encourage professionals to think twice and provide a strong deterrent when making hasty, rash and bias life changing decisions.

attributes.action: Allow working parents free childcare ALL YEAR up to the age of 10.
attributes.background: Working a full time job and having children is hard!  Reagrdless of whether you are single or a couple. The general work place gives 23ish days holiday while children are given 11 weeks,  with no family network to rely on childcare is very costly, almost to the point of it not being worth working.
attributes.additional_details:
You feel guilty if you do work and guilty if you dont! If you want us to work and input into society, help us!
It would be easier to go on benfits and watch my children grow up. 
Help is really needed here! So many people are working just to pay for childcare not to mention how many must be left alone.
Let us have a quality of life with our children.

attributes.action: Cut Overseas Aid budget by 50% & give £7bn saved to NHS, rather than more taxes.
attributes.background: UK commits to UN target that each country gives 0.7% of GNI (Gross National Income) for Overseas Aid. Only 6 (inc UK) of the 28 participants achieve target - average for all is 0.30% - (OECD 2015). UK pays c10% of total - ie £14bn of £140bn. As NHS is in need, £7bn could save it. Charity at home!
attributes.additional_details:
Source 2015 OECD.

The other 5 countries hitting the target are: Netherlands, Denmark, Luxembourg, Norway and Sweden - all relatively small economies, with positive attitudes to aid.  

The other members of the G8 seem to have an alternative attitude: USA 0.17%, Japan 0.22%, Russia 0%, Canada 0.28%, Italy 0.21%, Germany 0.52%, France 0.37%.

If we went to half of what we currently pay, we'd still be achieving 0.35%; still more than all other G8 members apart from Germany and, marginally, France.

attributes.action: Please keep our Island Studio school OPEN in East Cowes Isle of Wight
attributes.background:
Do NOT CLOSE this school. 
If the current proprietors cannot or will not continue running it, then allow SOMEONE ELSE to run it.
We need diversity of opportunity.
But start at a lower age so children can choose to go to have their full secondary education at this school. Make it 11-19, not 14-19.

attributes.action: Government needs to require harassment training for late night venue licenses
attributes.background: By training staff once a year, venues can ensure that staff know what to do and who to report to, ensuring women feel safe.This can be provided by existing trainers, and has been piloted in Southwark council. Training costs, which are low, could be covered by the venues.
attributes.additional_details: I work with women who experience abuse and see an increase in abuse to women especially in late night venues. Government needs to address the rising levels of sexual harassment that women experience in late night bars and clubs, by changing licensing laws to require landlords and venue owners to train staff on how to respond to sexual harassment complaints effectively.  A change in the law will ensure a clear message to those who harass others, and to those who just want the harassment to stop.

attributes.action: Make mandatory that vehicle manufacturers install remotely activated immobiliser
attributes.background: To assist with vehicles that 'fail to stop' for police and being used as weapons in terror attacks, all vehicles should be fitted with remotely activated immobilisers which can be activated by authorities or owners if thier vehicle is stolen or used in crime.
attributes.additional_details: This will help prevent the many deaths we have seen in police pursuits and vehicles being used as weapons in recent terror attacks.

attributes.action: Encourage schools to expell students who are bullying others.
attributes.background: All across the world, students are bullied in school. However, this is increasing dramatically. Head teachers should be encouraged to expel students who are bullying other students, as the victims often do not feel safe while the bullies are around.
attributes.additional_details: Young people/students have enough school related stress to deal with such as exams and coursework. Being bullied can affect their grades, their self esteem and in a lot of cases, their lives. Schools should be encouraged to expel individuals who bully others, out of respect for the victims. Many young people do not feel safe in school due to bullying, and this must stop altogether.

attributes.action: Stop Government bTB tests being a death sentence on healthy animals.
attributes.background: Alpaca owners want the Government to work with them to eradicate bovine tuberculosis(btb). Testing rules are draconian and need to be reviewed. Please support a testing regime that does not condemn a healthy alpaca to death by always allowing a retest where no substantial evidence for disease exits.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment less than 7% of alpacas have been tested and the industry wants that to be at least 80%. 

bTB test results are not being shared by APHA or collated and thus no opportunity exists to improve the current situation. Animals are unnecessarily culled before the data is captured. The situation will never improve unless we all work together to learn more about these unique animals for the benefit of all livestock keepers in the UK.

attributes.action: Make health workers exempt from parking tickets when delivering a public service
attributes.background: Allow domiciliary carers, emergency services, District nurses and doctors to park on single or double yellow lines when carrying out a health service for the public in their own homes.
attributes.additional_details: Care workers,District nurse,emergency services&doctors find it difficult to park when delivering a care service.if they display a notice,when parked on yellow lines, explaining they're there for a reason,they should be exempt from parking tickets within a certain time frame.The health services are under massive constraints&strains&are extremely limited to time,Parking issues need to be addressed. Councils pay for care to be delivered but penalise those very people when parking is unavailable.

attributes.action: Ban TV alcohol advertising completely.
attributes.background:
There are far too many alcohol adverts on TV. Pretty much all of them glamourise alcohol use, making it seem like you'll have a more adventurous life by drinking.

Let's save our people, help alcoholics quit and reduce binge drinking, by banning alcohol advertising on TV completely!
attributes.additional_details:
We all know how much damage alcohol causes. Many thousands of people are hospitalised yearly due to the use (or OVER use) of alcohol.

It is a scourge on our young people, in whom we are now seeing record levels of binge drinking amongst teenagers and people in their early 20s. 

The Beer federation at one point put out a literal "Beer goes with everything" advert. Why is this OK?

NO MORE ENCOURAGEMENT OF DRINKING BY GLAMOURISING IT IN OUR TV ADVERTISING!

attributes.action: There should be centrally funded, free, total and complete care for the elderly
attributes.background: I want to free the elderly from the huge burden of trying to fund their own care at the end of their lives.
attributes.additional_details:
I want to free the local authority from the burden of trying to fund care of the elderly when they do not have the money
I want to free the families from the burden of having to make up any shortfall in funding in order to give their loved ones the complete care they need
I want to see some meaningful return for the taxes we have paid throughout our working lives
Finally, it is the mark of a civilised nation that the state safeguards and has a duty of care towards the elderly: the most vulnerable In our society

attributes.action: Make councils set up payment plans for parking tickets instead of total payment
attributes.background: Make it so councils have to let people pay fines in installmemts for people who can’t afford to pay in a lump sum for parking tickets. Instead of passing it to private bailiff firms who add more costs and won’t accept an affordable payment plan until their fees have been added on.
attributes.additional_details: I had a parking ticket which I couldn’t pay in a lump sum.  The council wouldn’t let me pay in installmemts so it got passed to the bailiffs and more charges put on. Then they came and clamped my van I use for self employed work and removed it after they were told it was for my business and valued under £1350. I have a 7 year old child who I can not get to school anymore and I have no income now and have complained and appealed but still no van. I made payments but they wanted £80 a month.

attributes.action: Introduce new opportunities for medically failing applicants for the military.
attributes.background: Applicants who have applied and had their heart set on starting a military career with the correct attitude, fitness and skills who are turned away for, in some cases, minor or none apparent disabilities or injuries should be given more opportunities or choices.
attributes.additional_details: The modern military is diverse and equal such as allowing women to fight on the front lines but the the fact that you may not be allowed to serve on the front lines or for your country in any role due to a predicted adherent or minor issue has affected the majority of applying citizens. I understand that the military is required to uphold certain standards and a minimum level of fitness, qualities and skills from it's personnel depending on the various roles. However, when a potential candidate is not given the chance to prove their usefulness, or given any chance of finding their place in the military things need to changed or at the very least looked into.

attributes.action: Councils should be able to nominate people to a different council for downsizing
attributes.background: The Government should extend the Right to Move to tenants who want to downsize. There are so many council tenants under occupying properties that bigger families desperately need.
attributes.additional_details: All councils & housing associations should be giving tenants an incentive to move out of these bigger properties, like allowing a tenant to be nominated to a borough of the tenants choice. Local authorities shouldn’t be allowed to apply a local connection test if it could disadvantage tenants who need or want to move across local authority boundaries to downsize.

attributes.action: We would like the livestock act 1953 to be amended to include alpaca and llama.
attributes.background: Our Alpaca boys were attacked by two lurchers, leaving them traumatised & having to re-home. No prosecution was possible as  the dogs do not fall under the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991, and llamas and alpacas are not protected by the Dogs (Protection of Livestock) Act 1953.
attributes.additional_details: We think this act should be amended to protect these animals.

attributes.action: Make Paper Carrier Bags & Packaging compulsory for shops and manufacturers
attributes.background: The Government introduced the 5p charge on carrier bags in shops they are now planning to implement it across all. BUT what they should be doing is stopping plastic being used- Paper Carrier Bags and packaging is far better for us and can be recycled easily this would be Enviromentally safer.
attributes.additional_details: Plastic carrier bags get into the water supply and sea causing harm to wild life and also in long run the food chain - Paper can be made to be biodegradable so if dumped would not cause harm to wild life and so would not harm us - let the UK 🇬🇧 be a world leader in starting to bring back the classic Paper Carrier Bags for shops and then front leader in Paper or biodegradable card for packaging for manufacturers

attributes.action: Recognise a need for local and government financial support for carers under 18
attributes.background: There are about 700,000 young carers (under 18) in the UK. They provide everyday care and support to their parents and relatives that adults carers do. However, they are not entitled to a such support as adult carers are. It is time the government considers how best to support these children.

attributes.action: Ban cyclists filtering on blind side and apply 1.5m rule in all cases
attributes.background: Cyclist's are putting themselves in danger passing through tiny gaps on blind side where they are not seen by motorists and should abide by the 1.5m passing rule to avoid causing dangerous road conditions and damage to vehicles where cyclists aren't insured

attributes.action: Pets in pet shops need to be in bigger and better tanks/cages. It’s just cruel.
attributes.background: Everyday you see rodents, such as hamsters, cavies, rabbits just stuck in tiny glass cages with little to no movement...and it is awful. I’d really like the legal cage requirements to be doubled as it breaks my heart seeing them in that condition
